content:
• Tuesday, August 9, 2011
  • F

    Ford (NYSE:F) shares gained 9.9% today after Bank of America's John Murphy pounded the table for...

    Ford (NYSE:F) shares gained 9.9% today after Bank of America's John Murphy pounded the table for the company. Murphy considers Ford's balance sheet much healthier than it was in 2008, and notes the company's valuation is well below historical levels. He also sees Ford gaining market share as its product cycle hits a "sweet spot."

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • VLTC

    Motricity (MOTR) has lost over half its value post-trading after its Q2 badly misses estimates....

    Motricity (MOTR) has lost over half its value post-trading after its Q2 badly misses estimates. EPS was $0.04, vs. expectations of $0.09, and revenue came in at $34.6M vs. consensus of $37M. For Q3, the company expects revenue in the range of $31.5 to $32.5M, far below Street expectations of $45M. Shares are -55% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:24 PM
  • LEAF

    Demand Media (DMD) announces Q2 earnings that largely beat estimates, but shares have jumped...

    Demand Media (DMD) announces Q2 earnings that largely beat estimates, but shares have jumped post-trading after the company's announces a three-year renewal and expansion of an ongoing advertising partnership with Google (NASDAQ:GOOG). DMD +17% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • DIS

    Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS): FQ3 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $10.7B (+7% Y/Y) beats by...

    Walt Disney (NYSE:DIS): FQ3 EPS of $0.78 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $10.7B (+7% Y/Y) beats by $0.2B. Shares -1.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • SPWR

    More on SunPower's (SPWRA) Q2 results: "We significantly improved inventory turns and reduced...

    More on SunPower's (SPWRA) Q2 results: "We significantly improved inventory turns and reduced inventory by 15% from the first quarter... We are on track to meet our second half profitability goals." Sees Q3 revenue at $700M-$750M and non-GAAP EPS $0.05-$0.15, vs. $0.21. Sees full-year revenue at $2.8B-$2.95B vs. $2.76B, non-GAAP EPS of $0.75-$1.25 vs. $0.70. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • MBI

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI): EPS $0.69 beats by $0.62. Revenue of $177M (-86% Y/Y) beats by $37M. Shares +3%...

    MBIA (NYSE:MBI): EPS $0.69 beats by $0.62. Revenue of $177M (-86% Y/Y) beats by $37M. Shares +3% AH. (BW).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • BAC

    All 30 Dow stocks end up higher, led by financial stocks. Biggest gainers: BofA BAC +16.9%,...

    All 30 Dow stocks end up higher, led by financial stocks. Biggest gainers: BofA BAC +16.9%, Alcoa AA +7.9%, American Express AXP +7.1%, JPMorgan JPM +6.9%, Travelers TRV +6.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • IBKR

    Interactive Brokers Group (IBKR +8.7%) racks up gains going into the close after Macquarie...

    Interactive Brokers Group (IBKR +8.7%) racks up gains going into the close after Macquarie upgraded the shares earlier today. The firm says the electronic broker's market making and brokerage units are likely to profit from the current volatile trading environment, which should allow it to easily come in above Q3 estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:53 PM
  • AGYS

    IT solutions provider Agilysis (AGYS -14%) hovers near its lows for the day after its FYQ1 EPS...

    IT solutions provider Agilysis (AGYS -14%) hovers near its lows for the day after its FYQ1 EPS missed estimates due to higher SG&A expenses and restructuring costs. Revenues were better, +15% Y/Y to $151M  as the company ramps up sales in its hopitality and retail business units.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • OLED

    OLED display technology developer Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) is up 17.1% after reporting Q2...

    OLED display technology developer Universal Display (NASDAQ:PANL) is up 17.1% after reporting Q2 revenue of $11.3M (+33% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.03, beating a consensus of $10M and -$0.07. Growth was driven by a 170% Y/Y increase in Commercial revenue, which includes chemical sales and royalties on display shipments. (PR) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM
  • SBUX

    Baird upgrades shares of Starbucks (SBUX +2.6%) to Outperform and says it expects the firm to...

    Baird upgrades shares of Starbucks (SBUX +2.6%) to Outperform and says it expects the firm to reap gains from emerging markets. In a move showing just how far the firm will go to protect profits, a company rep says some NY stores won't allow customers to plug-in laptops and hog valuable retail space endlessly.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • USO

    Rallying with stocks earlier today, the non-QE decision by the Fed pushes oil back below...

    Rallying with stocks earlier today, the non-QE decision by the Fed pushes oil back below $80/barrel. September WTI -3.5% at $78.49. USO -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • NP

    Neenah Paper (NYSE:NP), a manufacturer of specialty papers and materials, gains 19.7% after...

    Neenah Paper (NYSE:NP), a manufacturer of specialty papers and materials, gains 19.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $183M (+8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.49, beating a consensus of $179.2M and $0.48. Growth was driven by a 15% Y/Y sales increase for the company's Technical Products division. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM

  • Fed funds contracts - mentioned earlier today as pricing in only the smallest of rate hikes over...

    Fed funds contracts - mentioned earlier today as pricing in only the smallest of rate hikes over the next two years - rally sharply, eliminating nearly all chance of higher rates. The August 2013 contract +23 bps to 99.75 vs. the August 2011 at 99.91.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • CAG

    Shares of Conagra (CAG -5%) falter after the Ralcorp (RAH -2.5%)-Sarah Lee (SLE +0.5%) deal...

    Shares of Conagra (CAG -5%) falter after the Ralcorp (RAH -2.5%)-Sarah Lee (SLE +0.5%) deal makes RAH a tougher target to acquire, and could raise the bar on the current $4.9B offer.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • LMNX

    Luminex (LMNX +25%) holds on to lofty gains after its Q2 EPS nearly doubled estimates on a...

    Luminex (LMNX +25%) holds on to lofty gains after its Q2 EPS nearly doubled estimates on a four-fold increase in operating profits. Revenue handily beat with record sales from its consumables unit, coming in at $47.6M, vs. expectations of $40M. The company raises its FY sales outlook to $185M from $180M.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM

  • The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX -9.4%), still running red-hot fueled by market worry, broke just...

    The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX -9.4%), still running red-hot fueled by market worry, broke just slightly lower after the FOMC statement was released. The VIX is still at a level typically associated with concerns of "great economic stress," meaning the Fed's 2013-commitment did little to tamp out fear.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM | 1 Comment

  • The prints in the currency market are hard to believe, with the dollar and euro (FXE) completely...

    The prints in the currency market are hard to believe, with the dollar and euro (FXE) completely capitulating vs. the Swiss franc (FXF). USD/CHF now -6% for the day at CHF 7100. EUR/CHF -5.4% at CHF 1.013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • WYNN

    Citi upgrades shares of Wynn WYNN to Hold from Sell, contributing to a 4.2% gain in share price....

    Citi upgrades shares of Wynn WYNN to Hold from Sell, contributing to a 4.2% gain in share price. Rival MGM (MGM -5.1%) receives its own Buy rating, but can't keep up following its lukewarm Q2 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM
  • BWLD

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) pops 8.8% after Barclays initiates coverage with an Overweight rating...

    Buffalo Wild Wings (BWLD) pops 8.8% after Barclays initiates coverage with an Overweight rating and $70 PT. Barclays thinks the company is undervalued relative to high-growth peers, and views its brand as "differentiated in an otherwise crowded bar & grill segment."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • S

    Clearwire (CLWR -7.8%) isn't sharing in today's rally, as Merrill Lynch downgrades the troubled...

    Clearwire (CLWR -7.8%) isn't sharing in today's rally, as Merrill Lynch downgrades the troubled carrier to Underperform and sets a $0.50 PT (that's no typo). Doubting partner Sprint (NYSE:S) will come to the company's rescue, Merrill is skeptical Clearwire will get the financing it needs, and thinks it could run out of cash by mid-2012. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • AAL

    AMR (AMR +9.9%) plans to proceed with a spinoff of Eagle Airlines to shareholders, according to...

    AMR (AMR +9.9%) plans to proceed with a spinoff of Eagle Airlines to shareholders, according to an email from a company exec. Shares have been in a protracted freefall since the spinoff was originally announced, leading to some speculation the firm would back off its plans.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM
  • GTY

    Real estate trust Getty Realty (NYSE:GTY) is down 19.8% after announcing it hasn't been paid...

    Real estate trust Getty Realty (NYSE:GTY) is down 19.8% after announcing it hasn't been paid rent by its largest tenant, Getty Petroleum Marketing, due to the latter's "distressed financial position, weakness in operating margins, and cash flow deficiencies." Judging by the market's response, it doesn't expect this problem to be resolved quickly.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • VLO

    OPEC cuts its global oil demand growth forecast for 2011 by another 150,000 barrels/day, and...

    OPEC cuts its global oil demand growth forecast for 2011 by another 150,000 barrels/day, and warns that weaker-than-expected consumption could cut the outlook further. But crude oil, now +0.5% to $81.68/barrel, and oil stocks (XOI +2.6%) rebound from yesterday's selloff. Among major producers and refiners: VLO +8%, ESV +7%, MRO +6.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • AAPL

    Apple (AAPL +3.6%) passes Exxon Mobil (XOM -0.3%) as the world's largest market cap, breaking...

    Apple (AAPL +3.6%) passes Exxon Mobil (XOM -0.3%) as the world's largest market cap, breaking through the $350B barrier. But that's just child's play says one tech writer who makes the case for a +$1T market cap for the Cupertino giant.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • SYKE

    Customer service outsourcing firm Sykes Enterprises (NASDAQ:SYKE) falls 27.8% after reporting Q2...

    Customer service outsourcing firm Sykes Enterprises (NASDAQ:SYKE) falls 27.8% after reporting Q2 revenue of $309.9M (+7% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.29, compared with a consensus of $307.8M and $0.33. Citing "sluggish demand forecasts from clients," Sykes expects 2011 revenue of $1.22B-$1.23B and EPS of $1.19-$1.24, below a consensus of $1.24B and $1.49.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • DTSI

    Audio technology developer DTS (NASDAQ:DTSI) falls 15.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $20.6M...

    Audio technology developer DTS (NASDAQ:DTSI) falls 15.7% after reporting Q2 revenue of $20.6M (+18% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.24, below a consensus of $21.8M and $0.25. Citing macro concerns and soft consumer spending, the company is now guiding for 2011 revenue of $95M-$100M and EPS of $1.30-$1.42, below a consensus of $104M and $1.48.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM
  • KOG

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +9.8%) gains after Global Hunter ups the shares on valuation. The...

    Kodiak Oil & Gas (KOG +9.8%) gains after Global Hunter ups the shares on valuation. The stock has lost nearly 30% of its value over the past week, and on the heels of last Thursday's solid Q2 report, the firm recommends taking advantage of the recent weakness to buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • TTWO

    After falling AH yesterday on soft FQ1 results and FQ2 guidance, Take-Two Interactive...

    After falling AH yesterday on soft FQ1 results and FQ2 guidance, Take-Two Interactive (NASDAQ:TTWO) is up 6.3%, as the market is calmed by relatively healthy FY12 guidance. However, Rick Aristotle Munarriz remains a skeptic, given Take-Two's light FY12 game pipeline, and the potential for the NBA lockout to hurt sales of NBA 2K12.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:03 PM
  • C

    Faint praise but they'll take it, as Citigroup (C +8.7%) now leads the bounce in financial...

    Faint praise but they'll take it, as Citigroup (C +8.7%) now leads the bounce in financial shares (XLF +3.5%) after Oppenheimer analysts write it is much better positioned to weather a recession now than in 2008. Other banks on the Oppenheimer note’s favored list include Wells Fargo (WFC +5.1%), which was also upgraded earlier, JPM +3.3% and USB +2.5%. BAC now +7.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • CBS

    CBS gains over 10% this morning after Argus Research upped the shares to buy on valuation. Both...

    CBS gains over 10% this morning after Argus Research upped the shares to buy on valuation. Both non-ad and core ad revenue streams continue to improve at the media giant, and with yesterdays selloff pushing the shares down nearly 18% off recent highs, the stock shows compelling value.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM
  • TZOO

    Travelzoo (TZOO +10%) keeps moving higher after saying earlier it had sold its one millionth...

    Travelzoo (TZOO +10%) keeps moving higher after saying earlier it had sold its one millionth Local Deals voucher. The company noted it's on track to exceed $100M in annualized gross revenues from the voucher business, and currently has listed over 2,000 Local Deals from restaurants, spas and other businesses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • GOOG

    Shares of Motorola (MMI +5%) get a lift from some positive comments made by CEO Sanjay Jha at...

    Shares of Motorola (MMI +5%) get a lift from some positive comments made by CEO Sanjay Jha at Oppenheimer's Technology Conference this morning. He says Droid 3 sales are doing better than expected, and the company expects to launch "much more interesting products in Q4," hinting that the upcoming 4G Droid Bionic phone will be "more than just a phone."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:06 PM
  • HUN

    Huntsman (NYSE:HUN) jumps 14.9% after insiders are reported to be aggressively buying shares...

    Huntsman (NYSE:HUN) jumps 14.9% after insiders are reported to be aggressively buying shares following a post-Q2 earnings report selloff in shares last week. Both execs who bought this week have clocked close to a 10% gain based on today's price movement.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR +12.8%) jumps after SEC filings disclose four executives,...

    MEMC Electronic Materials (WFR +12.8%) jumps after SEC filings disclose four executives, including Chief Executive Officer Ahmad Chatila, bought a combined 87,500 shares last Friday.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • NOG

    Northern Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:NOG) catapults 30% after beating Q2 earnings estimates by $0.14...

    Northern Oil & Gas (NYSEMKT:NOG) catapults 30% after beating Q2 earnings estimates by $0.14 on revenue of $35.5M (+204% Y/Y). Jumping off the balance sheet is the firm's attractive $77M in cash vs $0 long-term debt, positioning it to finance future development. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • STAR

    iStar Financial (SFI +22.6%) rises with the rest of the financials on renewed optimism for more...

    iStar Financial (SFI +22.6%) rises with the rest of the financials on renewed optimism for more stimulus from the Fed this afternoon, plus an added boost from its announcement late yesterday of a new $65M stock repurchase program.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 1 Comment
  • AAPL

    Tech stocks bounce back, pushing Nasdaq ahead of the other major indexes after yesterday's...

    Tech stocks bounce back, pushing Nasdaq ahead of the other major indexes after yesterday's shellacking. Bellwethers Apple (AAPL +4.2%) and Google (GOOG +3.3%) are powering higher. Yahoo (YHOO +4.7%) shares move up after hitting their lowest P/E since 1997; the company is looking increasingly like tasty takeover bait.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • CVC

    Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) drops 10% after reporting Q2 results that fell short of expectations. The...

    Cablevision (NYSE:CVC) drops 10% after reporting Q2 results that fell short of expectations. The Street might be particularly bothered by a 27K sequential decline in video subscribers, and a mere 5K gain in broadband subscribers - another indication of strong competition from VZ and T. Time Warner Cable (TWC) also fell after announcing Q2 results. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM
  • FSYS

    Fuel Systems Solutions (NASDAQ:FSYS) rises 17.8% after reporting revenue of 116.6M (+16.8% Y/Y)...

    Fuel Systems Solutions (NASDAQ:FSYS) rises 17.8% after reporting revenue of 116.6M (+16.8% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.19, blowing away a consensus of $92.4M and $0.13. Gross margin was 23.2%, down from 25.8% in Q2 2010.  The company expects 2011 revenue of $375M-$400M, in line with a $387.4M consensus, and a gross margin of 23-25%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • MAKO

    Medical robotics company MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) is up 29.5% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Medical robotics company MAKO Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) is up 29.5% after reporting Q2 revenue of $18.6M (+81% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.24 (-$0.18 exc. stock compensation), compared with a consensus of $16.1M and -$0.24. 12 RIO robotic arm systems were sold during the quarter, up from 7 in Q1. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • AOL

    Shares of AOL (AOL -13.8%) take a beating following the firm's disappointing Q2 report released...

    Shares of AOL (AOL -13.8%) take a beating following the firm's disappointing Q2 report released premarket highlighed by a dismal 20% drop in subscriber revenue. Shares traded down 19.6% before staging a mini-rally.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:42 AM
  • ENOC

    EnerNOC (ENOC -36.2%) gets hammered after its Q2 came up short on profit. The company reported...

    EnerNOC (ENOC -36.2%) gets hammered after its Q2 came up short on profit. The company reported an EPS loss of $0.31, which was better than estimates, but revenue came in at $58.9M, which was below expectations of $62M. The company also lowers guidance for Q3 and FY11 due to a weakening economic outlook and reduced demand.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America's (BAC +6.3%) Brian Moynihan seeks to ease worries, and shares are bouncing back...

    Bank of America's (BAC +6.3%) Brian Moynihan seeks to ease worries, and shares are bouncing back a bit today. But he apparently failed to learn in 2008 that there's a difference between the amount of equity a bank needs to run its business and the amount it needs to maintain market confidence. With shares -35% in a week, shareholders are paying the price.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:31 AM | 1 Comment
  • LUV

    File under the harder they fall: Airline stocks (FAA +3.1%,) gain early as the sector makes a...

    File under the harder they fall: Airline stocks (FAA +3.1%,) gain early as the sector makes a case it was oversold yesterday on earnings concerns. Strong gainers: LUV +2.1%, AMR +11.1%, UAL +4.9%, DAL +3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • LLNW

    More on Limelight's (NASDAQ:LLNW) Q2: With rival Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) having also been crushed...

    More on Limelight's (NASDAQ:LLNW) Q2: With rival Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) having also been crushed following Q2 results, Limelight's troubles clearly aren't just company-specific. However, the fact the company's gross margin remains a fraction of Akamai's 67.7% is a sign Limelight is struggling to command premium pricing for its value-added services offerings.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • STXS

    Shares of cardiology equipment maker Stereotaxis (STXS -57.3%) are cut in half after temporarily...

    Shares of cardiology equipment maker Stereotaxis (STXS -57.3%) are cut in half after temporarily suspending 2011 financial guidance and announcing that its CFO would leave the company. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:46 AM
  • LLNW

    Content delivery network operator Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) is down 27.3% after reporting...

    Content delivery network operator Limelight Networks (NASDAQ:LLNW) is down 27.3% after reporting Q2 revenue of $50.5M (+20% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.05, below a consensus of $52.4M and -$0.03. Gross margin was 37%, down from 41% in Q1. Free cash flow was -$9.87M.  Q3 revenue guidance of $51.7M-$53.2M is below a consensus of $57.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • MCD

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) receives an upgrade from Goldman to Buy from Neutral, and is added to the...

    McDonald's (NYSE:MCD) receives an upgrade from Goldman to Buy from Neutral, and is added to the firm's Conviction List. In a note to clients, Goldman cites the company's strong same-store sales and a low correlation to macroeconomic drivers. Shares +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:25 AM | 3 Comments
  • XIN

    Premarket gainers: XIN +26%. PZG +19%. NBG +11%. RIO +10%. ALU +8%. SD +8%. ARMH +7%. FRO +7%....

    Premarket gainers: XIN +26%. PZG +19%. NBG +11%. RIO +10%. ALU +8%. SD +8%. ARMH +7%. FRO +7%. DRYS +7%. BHP +7%. ABB +6%. MCP +5%. NYX +5%. BAC +5%. ASML +5%. HAL +5%. DNDN +5%. ERIC +5%. IRE +4%. MPEL +4%. TS +5%. CAJ +4%. NOK +4%. MT +4%. C +3%. MGM +4%. PCX +4%. SDRL +4%. ING +4%. BCS +4%. FCX +3%. LVS +3%. LVLT +3%. AA +3%. S +3%. BP +3%.
    Losers: FOSL -21%. SOL -7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • SOL

    Chinese solar wafer vendor ReneSola (NYSE:SOL), which issued a warning on 7/12, is down 3.6%...

    Chinese solar wafer vendor ReneSola (NYSE:SOL), which issued a warning on 7/12, is down 3.6% premarket after reporting Q2 revenue of $249.3M (-31% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.02, compared with a consensus of $238.3M and $0.16. The company is expecting Q3 revenue of $220M-$240M, below a $276.9M consensus. Full-year guidance is being withdrawn.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:57 AM
  • PFE

    Shares of Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) gain 1.8% premarket, helped along after Goldman adds the company to...

    Shares of Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) gain 1.8% premarket, helped along after Goldman adds the company to its Conviction Buy list with a $22 price target. The firm cites strong management, pipeline catalysts and R&D restructuring as adding long-term upside potential to shares of the drugmaker.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:54 AM
  • MSFT

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD) gain 6.3% premarket as early investors look at yesterday's 17.4% drop,...

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD) gain 6.3% premarket as early investors look at yesterday's 17.4% drop, as a bit overdone - compared to other tech favorites - after the firm's earnings beat and upward guidance issued last week did not resonate.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:37 AM

  • The dust still clears from a wacky 48 hours for shares of Rio Tinto. A combined buyout with...

    The dust still clears from a wacky 48 hours for shares of Rio Tinto. A combined buyout with Mitsubishi of Coal & Allied Industries was followed by a mysterious flash crash in Monday's trading of shares in Australia. Shares in the U.S. are now +9.8% premarket following a sharp 11% drop yesterday as investors try to sort it all out.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:25 AM
  • WFC

    FBR calls Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) an attractive buy, and slates the company on its Top Picks...

    FBR calls Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) an attractive buy, and slates the company on its Top Picks list. The firm says its upgrade to Outperform presumes "bank investors will flock to quality names that can best weather the adverse effect of a flattening yield curve." Shares +3.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 1 Comment

  • Some green is starting to poke through in Europe, where France has turned positive by 0.9%. The...

    Some green is starting to poke through in Europe, where France has turned positive by 0.9%. The U.K., Spain, and Italy have all narrowed their losses to less than 1%. Germany is the laggard, -1.6% after being down more than 5% earlier. Stoxx 50 -0.1%. U.S. stock index futures push higher, S&P 500 +1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 AM

  • Any earlier resistance by European stocks appears to be over and they are taking a pounding...

    Any earlier resistance by European stocks appears to be over and they are taking a pounding again. EURO STOXX 50 -3.4%, London -3.6%, Paris -3%, Frankfurt -4.8%, Madrid -2.7%, Milan -2.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 AM
  • HSBC

    HSBC (HBC) confirms it's in talks to sell its U.S. credit card and retail services business...

    HSBC (HBC) confirms it's in talks to sell its U.S. credit card and retail services business following a report yesterday that Capital One (NYSE:COF) is in negotiations to buy the U.K. bank's $30B U.S. credit-card portfolio. However, HSBC didn't comment on whether COF is involved. HSBC -6.4% in London.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 AM

  • European shares are lower in early trading, and while not at yesterday's magnitude, stocks are...

    European shares are lower in early trading, and while not at yesterday's magnitude, stocks are beginning to slide from previous highs, which included gains. EURO STOXX 50 -0.8%, Paris -0.7%, London -1.3%, Frankfurt -1.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 AM

  • U.S. futures hit positive territory after losses earlier in Asia. S&P 500 futures +0.9%...

    U.S. futures hit positive territory after losses earlier in Asia. S&P 500 futures +0.9% after sliding as much as 3%. Dow is +0.4% and Nasdaq is +0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:49 AM | 9 Comments
